definition: lit. the old man lost his horse, but it all turned out for the best (idiom)/fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
Serbia/Serbian/abbr. for 塞爾維亞|塞尔维亚[Sai1 er3 wei2 ya4]
to stop up/to squeeze in/to stuff/cork/stopper
strategic pass/tactical border position
to stop up/to stuff/to cope with
surname Weng
elderly man/father/father-in-law/neck feathers of a bird (old)
to lose/to miss/to fail
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
the old man lost his mare, but it all turned out for the best (idiom); fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good/also written 塞翁失馬焉知非福|塞翁失马焉知非福
pinyin: sai4 weng1 shi1 ma3 an1 zhi1 fei1 fu2

definition: the old man lost his mare, but it all turned out for the best (idiom); fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
pinyin: sai4 weng1 shi1 ma3 yan1 zhi1 fei1 fu2

sentences.english: Losing your job was just a blessing in disguise.
sentences.chinese: 看来失去原来的工作对你来说是“塞翁失马”啊。
灾祸是福，塞翁失马焉知非福。

sentences.english: Mr. Reisinger views the housing slump as a blessing in disguise.
sentences.chinese: 雷辛格认为房市衰退可谓是塞翁失马。

sentences.english: "A blessing in disguise" is a good thing that you don't recognize at first as a good thing.
sentences.chinese: “塞翁失马”是你不认识首先是一件好事好事。

sentences.english: His fail in the match was just a blessing in disguise.
sentences.chinese: 他在比赛中的失利只是塞翁失马。

sentences.english: It means that a bad thing may become good thing under certain condition.
sentences.chinese: “塞翁失马”比喻事事多变，坏事可以变成好事。

definition: the old man lost his mare, but it all turned out for the best (idiom); fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
pinyin: sai4 weng1 shi1 ma3 yan1 zhi1 fei1 fu2

definition: to lose at sunrise but gain at sunset (idiom)/to compensate later for one's earlier loss/what you lose on the swings you gain on the roundabouts
pinyin: shi1 zhi1 dong1 yu2 , shou1 zhi1 sang1 yu2

definition: see 失之東隅，收之桑榆|失之东隅，收之桑榆[shi1 zhi1 dong1 yu2 , shou1 zhi1 sang1 yu2]
(literary) how is one to know?
extreme joy turns to sorrow (idiom); Don't celebrate too soon, things could still go wrong!
one is bound for good fortune after surviving a great disaster (proverb)
pinyin: da4 nan4 bu4 si3 , bi4 you3 hou4 fu2

definition: fortune favors fools (idiom)/fool's luck
extreme sorrow turns to joy (idiom)
to profit from a disaster (idiom); some good comes out of a setback/It's an ill wind that blows nobody any good.
to thrive in calamity and perish in soft living (idiom)/life springs from sorrow and calamity, death comes from ease and pleasure
pinyin: sheng1 yu2 you1 huan4 , si3 yu2 an1 le4

definition: blessings never come in pairs (idiom)
lit. a wise person reflecting a thousand times can still make a mistake (idiom); fig. nobody is infallible
pinyin: zhi4 zhe3 qian1 lu:4 , bi4 you3 yi1 shi1

definition: disaster and happiness do not follow rules (idiom); future blessings and misfortunes are unpredictable
to buy a wooden box and return the pearls inside/to show poor judgment (idiom)
lit. a notch on the side of a boat to locate a sword dropped overboard (idiom); fig. an action made pointless by changed circumstances
lit. sandpiper and clam war together (and the fisherman catches both) (idiom); fig. neighbors who can't agree lose out to a third party
